result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanya L. Wentworth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

2:56 p.m. Defendant Tanya L. Wentworth in court, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant statement that she is on a probation hold and then goes immediately to 30-day treatment in Koinonia. Adj. 2:57 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

4:17 p.m. Defendant Tanya L. Wentworth in court.  Defendant states she just got out of prison - just obtained job - requests 6 month review date.  Review hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

02:31 pm - Defendant Tanya L. Wentworth in court with attorney Robert E. Hanson.  Defendant Tanya L. Wentworth in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  State moves to amend to 961.41(3g)(c) - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Hanson/Court statement to sentencing.  
Court Sentence - CC to revocation sentence
Jail 1 year
